channel.title: Help!
channel.description:
Ive been trying to fix these errors, but can't! :eek: [code].\Client.java:8122: illegal start of expression public void showMenu(); { ^ .\Client.java:8122: illegal start of expression public void showMenu(); { ^ .\Client.java:8122: ';' expected public void showMenu(); { ^ .\GodWarWaitingRoom.java:161: reached end of file while parsing }; ^ 4 errors Press any key to continue . . .
[/code] How can i fix this? Thanks
~~WaleedScape~~

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @WaleedScape WaleedScape
item.description:
@WaleedScape wrote:

Thank you! i would rep you, but can’t

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“1pure1337, post:3, topic:349090”]just wow, are you completely retarded they should look like this…

.\Client.java:8122: illegal start of expression
public void showMenu();
{
^
.\Client.java:8122: illegal start of expression
public void showMenu();
{
^
.\Client.java:8122: ‘;’ expected
public void showMenu();
{

Just press enter next to the ; and brind down the bracket :S.[/quote]
LOL! Please, if you’re going to call people retarded then please TRY to get it right yourself.

They’re supposed to look like this.

public void showMenu()
{

It does not matter what line the brace is on. Also, just a tip, putting a semi-colon after a method name is saying that it doesn’t have a body, and this is not correct unless you state it as an abstract method or it’s inside an interface.

Read full topic

^

public void showMenu();
{
^
.\Client.java:8122: ‘;’ expected
public void showMenu();
{

Just press enter next to the ; and brind down the bracket :S.

@usman555 wrote:

delete the “;” after the “}”
if it doesnt work, then add it back
